body: Several types of magical bullets have been developed to be used with firearms. The following represent just a few of these types.
name: Specific Firearm Ammunition
url: pfsrd://Ultimate Combat/Rules/Mastering Combat/Firearms/Firearm Magic Items/Specific Firearm Ammunition

sections.name: Burrowing Bullet
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Combat/Rules/Mastering Combat/Firearms/Firearm Magic Items/Specific Firearm Ammunition/Burrowing Bullet
sections.price: 1,722 gp (burrowing bullet) or 3,447 gp (greater burrowing bullet)

Construction.Cost: 861 gp (burrowing bullet) or 1,723 gp (greater burrowing bullet)
Construction.Requirements: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, symbol of pain (burrowing bullet) or symbol of stunning (greater burrowing bullet)

sections.body: This +1 firearm bullet deals normal damage, but when it hits a living creature, it burrows into the creature's flesh, causing wracking pain until removed or until the bullet burrows its way out of the creature. While these bullets burrow, the creature is staggered. This effect lasts for 1d3 rounds or until the bullet is removed with a DC 15 Heal check made as a standard action. Greater burrowing bullets take longer to pass though the bodies of living creatures (the staggered effect lasts 1d3+2 rounds) and are harder to remove (DC 20 Heal check as a standard action).
sections.name: Description
Tracer Bullet
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Combat/Rules/Mastering Combat/Firearms/Firearm Magic Items/Specific Firearm Ammunition/Tracer Bullet

Construction.Requirements: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, faerie fire

sections.body: These +1 firearm bullets deal no damage, but instead cause a pale glow to outline the target, granting the effect of a faerie fire spell and causing the target to take a –2 penalty to AC against ranged attacks. These effects last for 1d4 rounds.
